node.title: Students design for Øya
node.excerpt: This week, over 2000 students from across the globe will compete to design a new meeting point and icon for the Øya Festival.

node.title: Only 2000 week passes left
node.excerpt: Added to the line-up: The Julie Ruin (US), Jungle (UK), Brody Dalle (US) and Farao

node.title: Darkside to play Øya Saturday 9th of August
node.excerpt: The album Pshycic got very good reviews and made several important album-of-the-year-lists.

node.title: Slowdive to play Øya on Saturday 9th of August
node.excerpt: The band’s plan is to visit a few selected festivals in 2014, and we are proud that Øya is one of them

node.title: The National, Blood Orange and King Midas to play Øya
node.excerpt: 60 % of the week passes are sold

node.title: Janelle Monáe at Øya 7th of August
Queens Of The Stone Age to headline Øya on August 6th
node.excerpt: The most consistent hard rock band so far this century

node.title: Röyksopp & Robyn together on stage Friday 8th of August
Øya 2013 – the best ever!
node.excerpt: Øya Festival 2013 is over. During four days in The Medieval Park and an enormous amount of club shows in the city centre, several thousand people enjoyed good music. The concerts were well attended by curious music lovers. Even the more unknown acts in the line-up, drew a good crowd. It has been a wonderful festival – from the […]
